items.title: Awesome Machine Learning
items.content_text:
### Python / Python Survival Analysis

*   [lifelines (‚≠ê2.5k)](https://github.com/CamDavidsonPilon/lifelines) - lifelines is a complete survival analysis library, written in pure Python
*   [Scikit-Survival (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/sebp/scikit-survival) - scikit-survival is a Python module for survival analysis built on top of scikit-learn. It allows doing survival analysis while utilizing the power of scikit-learn, e.g., for pre-processing or doing cross-validation.

### R / General-Purpose Machine Learning

*   [CORElearn](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/CORElearn/index.html) - CORElearn: Classification, regression, feature evaluation and ordinal evaluation.
    -\* [CoxBoost](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/CoxBoost/index.html) - CoxBoost: Cox models by likelihood based boosting for a single survival endpoint or competing risks **\[Deprecated]**
items.content_html:
Python / Python Survival Analysis

  • lifelines (‚≠ê2.5k) - lifelines is a complete survival analysis library, written in pure Python
  • Scikit-Survival (‚≠ê1.2k) - scikit-survival is a Python module for survival analysis built on top of scikit-learn. It allows doing survival analysis while utilizing the power of scikit-learn, e.g., for pre-processing or doing cross-validation.

R / General-Purpose Machine Learning

  • CORElearn - CORElearn: Classification, regression, feature evaluation and ordinal evaluation. -* CoxBoost - CoxBoost: Cox models by likelihood based boosting for a single survival endpoint or competing risks [Deprecated]

items.title: Awesome Raspberry Pi
items.content_text:
### OS Images

*   [openSUSE](https://en.opensuse.org/HCL:Raspberry_Pi) - openSUSE is a major Linux distribution that has images based for its stable release Leap and rolling release Tumbleweed. Images can be found for many of the Pis, including the [Raspberry Pi 3](https://en.opensuse.org/HCL:Raspberry_Pi3) and [Raspberry Pi 4](https://en.opensuse.org/HCL:Raspberry_Pi4).

### Projects

*   [CocktailMaker (‚≠ê153)](https://github.com/alex9849/pi-cocktail-maker) - An advanced cocktail making machine that can be controlled via browser and touchscreen.

### Books / iOS

*   [The Official Raspberry Pi Handbook 2022](https://magpi.raspberrypi.com/books/handbook-2022) - A guide to help you get the most of your Raspberry Pi computer, essential information, project ideas, tutorials, and reviews. **Updated for Raspberry Pi Pico.**
items.content_html:
OS Images

  • openSUSE - openSUSE is a major Linux distribution that has images based for its stable release Leap and rolling release Tumbleweed. Images can be found for many of the Pis, including the Raspberry Pi 3 and Raspberry Pi 4.

Projects

  • CocktailMaker (‚≠ê153) - An advanced cocktail making machine that can be controlled via browser and touchscreen.

Books / iOS

  • The Official Raspberry Pi Handbook 2022 - A guide to help you get the most of your Raspberry Pi computer, essential information, project ideas, tutorials, and reviews. Updated for Raspberry Pi Pico.

items.title: Awesome React Components
items.content_text:
### Editable data grid / spreadsheet

*   [fortune-sheet (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/ruilisi/fortune-sheet) - An online spreedsheet component that provides out-of-the-box features just like Excel.

### Loader

### Form Components / Miscellaneous

### Data Store / Mouse Events

*   [synergies (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/lukasbach/synergies) - [docs](https://synergies.js.org) A performant and distributed context-state library for creating reusable React state logic by synergyzing atomar context pieces.

items.title: Awesome Zsh Plugins
items.content_text:
### Plugins / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [more-hooks-for-git (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/capsulescodes/more-hooks-for-git) - Adds extra hooks for `git add`, `git diff` and `git status`.
*   [wordle (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/zechris/zwordle) - Wordle for ZSH, with tab-completions.
*   [zenplash (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/Chivier/zenplash) - Creates files from templates stored in a user directory.

### Themes / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [radius (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/erikcc02/radius-zsh-theme) - Includes `git` status, username, hostname, and directory decorations, plus [desk (‚≠ê2.6k)](https://github.com/jamesob/desk) support.
*   [refpx (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/refpx/refpx-zsh-theme) - Includes `git` status, last command status, user\@hostname and directory decorations.
items.content_html:
Plugins / superconsole - Windows-only

  • more-hooks-for-git (‚≠ê2) - Adds extra hooks for git add, git diff and git status.
  • wordle (‚≠ê3) - Wordle for ZSH, with tab-completions.
  • zenplash (‚≠ê3) - Creates files from templates stored in a user directory.

Themes / superconsole - Windows-only

  • radius (‚≠ê1) - Includes git status, username, hostname, and directory decorations, plus desk (‚≠ê2.6k) support.
  • refpx (‚≠ê0) - Includes git status, last command status, user@hostname and directory decorations.

items.title: Awesome Go
items.content_text:
### Bit-packing and Compression

*   [crunch (‚≠ê100)](https://github.com/superwhiskers/crunch) - Go package implementing buffers for handling various datatypes easily.
*   [go-ef (‚≠ê39)](https://github.com/amallia/go-ef) - A Go implementation of the Elias-Fano encoding.
*   [roaring (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/RoaringBitmap/roaring) - Go package implementing compressed bitsets.

### Bloom and Cuckoo Filters

*   [cuckoofilter (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/seiflotfy/cuckoofilter) - Cuckoo filter: a good alternative to a counting bloom filter implemented in Go.
*   [ring (‚≠ê141)](https://github.com/TheTannerRyan/ring) - Go implementation of a high performance, thread safe bloom filter.

### Data Structure and Algorithm Collections

*   [algorithms (‚≠ê821)](https://github.com/shady831213/algorithms) - Algorithms and data structures.CLRS study.
*   [go-datastructures (‚≠ê7.8k)](https://github.com/Workiva/go-datastructures) - Collection of useful, performant, and thread-safe data structures.
*   [gods (‚≠ê17k)](https://github.com/emirpasic/gods) - Go Data Structures. Containers, Sets, Lists, Stacks, Maps, BidiMaps, Trees, HashSet etc.
*   [gostl (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/liyue201/gostl) - Data structure and algorithm library for go, designed to provide functions similar to C++ STL.

### Iterators

*   [goterator (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/yaa110/goterator) - Iterator implementation to provide map and reduce functionalities.
*   [iter (‚≠ê191)](https://github.com/disksing/iter) - Go implementation of C++ STL iterators and algorithms.

### Maps

*   [dict (‚≠ê47)](https://github.com/srfrog/dict) - Python-like dictionaries (dict) for Go.

### Nullable Types

*   [nan (‚≠ê87)](https://github.com/kak-tus/nan) - Zero allocation Nullable structures in one library with handy conversion functions, marshallers and unmarshallers.
*   [null (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/emvi/null) - Nullable Go types that can be marshalled/unmarshalled to/from JSON.
*   [typ (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/gurukami/typ) - Null Types, Safe primitive type conversion and fetching value from complex structures.

### Queues

*   [deque (‚≠ê200)](https://github.com/edwingeng/deque) - A highly optimized double-ended queue.
*   [deque (‚≠ê690)](https://github.com/gammazero/deque) - Fast ring-buffer deque (double-ended queue).
*   [goconcurrentqueue (‚≠ê427)](https://github.com/enriquebris/goconcurrentqueue) - Concurrent FIFO queue.
*   [memlog (‚≠ê133)](https://github.com/embano1/memlog) - An easy to use, lightweight, thread-safe and append-only in-memory data structure inspired by Apache Kafka.

### Sets

*   [dsu (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/ihebu/dsu) - Disjoint Set data structure implementation in Go.
*   [golang-set (‚≠ê4.5k)](https://github.com/deckarep/golang-set) - Thread-Safe and Non-Thread-Safe high-performance sets for Go.
*   [goset (‚≠ê52)](https://github.com/zoumo/goset) - A useful Set collection implementation for Go.
*   [set (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/StudioSol/set) - Simple set data structure implementation in Go using LinkedHashMap.

### Text Analysis

*   [bleve (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/blevesearch/bleve) - Modern text indexing library for go.
*   [go-adaptive-radix-tree (‚≠ê392)](https://github.com/plar/go-adaptive-radix-tree) - Go implementation of Adaptive Radix Tree.
*   [go-edlib (‚≠ê517)](https://github.com/hbollon/go-edlib) - Go string comparison and edit distance algorithms library (Levenshtein, LCS, Hamming, Damerau levenshtein, Jaro-Winkler, etc.) compatible with Unicode.
*   [trie (‚≠ê776)](https://github.com/derekparker/trie) - Trie implementation in Go.

### Trees

*   [hashsplit (‚≠ê31)](http://github.com/bobg/hashsplit) - Split byte streams into chunks, and arrange chunks into trees, with boundaries determined by content, not position.
*   [merkle (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/bobg/merkle) - Space-efficient computation of Merkle root hashes and inclusion proofs.

### Pipes

*   [ordered-concurrently (‚≠ê41)](https://github.com/tejzpr/ordered-concurrently) - Go module that processes work concurrently and returns output in a channel in the order of input.
*   [parapipe (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/nazar256/parapipe) - FIFO Pipeline which parallels execution on each stage while maintaining the order of messages and results.
*   [pipeline (‚≠ê58)](https://github.com/hyfather/pipeline) - An implementation of pipelines with fan-in and fan-out.

### Caches

*   [2q (‚≠ê47)](https://github.com/floatdrop/2q) - 2Q in-memory cache implementation.
*   [couchcache (‚≠ê67)](https://github.com/codingsince1985/couchcache) - RESTful caching micro-service backed by Couchbase server.
*   [fastcache (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/VictoriaMetrics/fastcache) - fast thread-safe inmemory cache for big number of entries. Minimizes GC overhead.
*   [GCache (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/bluele/gcache) - Cache library with support for expirable Cache, LFU, LRU and ARC.
*   [gdcache (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/ulovecode/gdcache) - A pure non-intrusive cache library implemented by golang, you can use it to implement your own distributed cache.
*   [go-mcache (‚≠ê98)](https://github.com/OrlovEvgeny/go-mcache) - Fast in-memory key:value store/cache library. Pointer caches.
*   [groupcache (‚≠ê13k)](https://github.com/golang/groupcache) - Groupcache is a caching and cache-filling library, intended as a replacement for memcached in many cases.
*   [timedmap (‚≠ê75)](https://github.com/zekroTJA/timedmap) - Map with expiring key-value pairs.
*   [ttlcache (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/jellydator/ttlcache) - An in-memory cache with item expiration and generics.
*   [ttlcache (‚≠ê10)](https://github.com/cheshir/ttlcache) - In-memory key value storage with TTL for each record.

### Databases Implemented in Go

*   [badger (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/dgraph-io/badger) - Fast key-value store in Go.
*   [bbolt (‚≠ê8.9k)](https://github.com/etcd-io/bbolt) - An embedded key/value database for Go.
*   [Bitcask](https://git.mills.io/prologic/bitcask) - Bitcask is an embeddable, persistent and fast key-value (KV) database written in pure Go with predictable read/write performance, low latency and high throughput thanks to the bitcask on-disk layout (LSM+WAL).
*   [buntdb (‚≠ê4.7k)](https://github.com/tidwall/buntdb) - Fast, embeddable, in-memory key/value database for Go with custom indexing and spatial support.
*   [clover (‚≠ê760)](https://github.com/ostafen/clover) - A lightweight document-oriented NoSQL database written in pure Golang.
*   [pudge (‚≠ê373)](https://github.com/recoilme/pudge) - Fast and simple key/value store written using Go's standard library.

### Database Tools

*   [clickhouse-bulk (‚≠ê498)](https://github.com/nikepan/clickhouse-bulk) - Collects small inserts and sends big requests to ClickHouse servers.

### Interfaces to Multiple Backends

*   [cayley (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/google/cayley) - Graph database with support for multiple backends.
*   [dsc (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/viant/dsc) - Datastore connectivity for SQL, NoSQL, structured files.
*   [gokv (‚≠ê801)](https://github.com/philippgille/gokv) - Simple key-value store abstraction and implementations for Go (Redis, Consul, etcd, bbolt, BadgerDB, LevelDB, Memcached, DynamoDB, S3, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, CockroachDB and many more).

### Relational Database Drivers

*   [avatica (‚≠ê122)](https://github.com/apache/calcite-avatica-go) - Apache Avatica/Phoenix SQL driver for database/sql.
*   [bgc (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/viant/bgc) - Datastore Connectivity for BigQuery for go.
*   [firebirdsql (‚≠ê243)](https://github.com/nakagami/firebirdsql) - Firebird RDBMS SQL driver for Go.
*   [go-adodb (‚≠ê148)](https://github.com/mattn/go-adodb) - Microsoft ActiveX Object DataBase driver for go that uses database/sql.
*   [go-mssqldb (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/denisenkom/go-mssqldb) - Microsoft MSSQL driver for Go.
*   [go-oci8 (‚≠ê634)](https://github.com/mattn/go-oci8) - Oracle driver for go that uses database/sql.
*   [go-sql-driver/mysql (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/go-sql-driver/mysql) - MySQL driver for Go.
*   [go-sqlite3 (‚≠ê8.6k)](https://github.com/mattn/go-sqlite3) - SQLite3 driver for go that uses database/sql.
*   [godror (‚≠ê559)](https://github.com/godror/godror) - Oracle driver for Go, using the ODPI-C driver.
*   [gofreetds (‚≠ê113)](https://github.com/minus5/gofreetds) - Microsoft MSSQL driver. Go wrapper over [FreeTDS](https://www.freetds.org).
*   [pgx (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/jackc/pgx) - PostgreSQL driver supporting features beyond those exposed by database/sql.
*   [pig (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/alexeyco/pig) - Simple [pgx (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/jackc/pgx) wrapper to execute and [scan (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/georgysavva/scany) query results easily.
*   [pq (‚≠ê9.5k)](https://github.com/lib/pq) - Pure Go Postgres driver for database/sql.
*   [Sqinn-Go (‚≠ê450)](https://github.com/cvilsmeier/sqinn-go) - SQLite with pure Go.
*   [sqlhooks (‚≠ê656)](https://github.com/qustavo/sqlhooks) - Attach hooks to any database/sql driver.

### NoSQL Database Drivers

*   [aerospike-client-go (‚≠ê450)](https://github.com/aerospike/aerospike-client-go) - Aerospike client in Go language.
*   [arangolite (‚≠ê72)](https://github.com/solher/arangolite) - Lightweight golang driver for ArangoDB.
*   [asc (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/viant/asc) - Datastore Connectivity for Aerospike for go.
*   [forestdb (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/couchbase/goforestdb) - Go bindings for ForestDB.
*   [go-couchbase (‚≠ê323)](https://github.com/couchbase/go-couchbase) - Couchbase client in Go.
*   [go-pilosa (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/pilosa/go-pilosa) - Go client library for Pilosa.
*   [go-rejson (‚≠ê343)](https://github.com/nitishm/go-rejson) - Golang client for redislabs' ReJSON module using Redigo golang client. Store and manipulate structs as JSON objects in redis with ease.
*   [gocb (‚≠ê373)](https://github.com/couchbase/gocb) - Official Couchbase Go SDK.
*   [gocosmos (‚≠ê22)](https://github.com/btnguyen2k/gocosmos) - REST client and standard `database/sql` driver for Azure Cosmos DB.
*   [gocql](https://gocql.github.io) - Go language driver for Apache Cassandra.
*   [godis (‚≠ê113)](https://github.com/piaohao/godis) - redis client implement by golang, inspired by jedis.
*   [godscache (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/defcronyke/godscache) - A wrapper for the Google Cloud Platform Go Datastore package that adds caching using memcached.
*   [gomemcache (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/bradfitz/gomemcache/) - memcache client library for the Go programming language.
*   [gorethink (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/dancannon/gorethink) - Go language driver for RethinkDB.
*   [goriak (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/zegl/goriak) - Go language driver for Riak KV.
*   [neo4j (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/cihangir/neo4j) - Neo4j Rest API Bindings for Golang.
*   [neoism (‚≠ê390)](https://github.com/jmcvetta/neoism) - Neo4j client for Golang.
*   [qmgo (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/qiniu/qmgo) - The MongoDB driver for Go. It‚Äòs based on official MongoDB driver but easier to use like Mgo.
*   [redeo (‚≠ê445)](https://github.com/bsm/redeo) - Redis-protocol compatible TCP servers/services.
*   [redigo (‚≠ê9.8k)](https://github.com/gomodule/redigo) - Redigo is a Go client for the Redis database.
*   [rueidis (‚≠ê2.7k)](http://github.com/rueian/rueidis) - Fast Redis RESP3 client with auto pipelining and server-assisted client side caching.
*   [xredis (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/shomali11/xredis) - Typesafe, customizable, clean & easy to use Redis client.

### Search and Analytic Databases

*   [elastic (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/olivere/elastic) - Elasticsearch client for Go.
*   [elasticsql (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/cch123/elasticsql) - Convert sql to elasticsearch dsl in Go.
*   [elastigo (‚≠ê942)](https://github.com/mattbaird/elastigo) - Elasticsearch client library.
*   [go-elasticsearch (‚≠ê5.9k)](https://github.com/elastic/go-elasticsearch) - Official Elasticsearch client for Go.
*   [goes (‚≠ê31)](https://github.com/OwnLocal/goes) - Library to interact with Elasticsearch.
*   [skizze (‚≠ê92)](https://github.com/seiflotfy/skizze) - probabilistic data-structures service and storage.

### DevOps Tools / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

*   [wait-for (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/dnnrly/wait-for) - Wait for something to happen (from the command line) before continuing. Easy orchestration of Docker services and other things.
items.content_html:
Bit-packing and Compression

  • crunch (‚≠ê100) - Go package implementing buffers for handling various datatypes easily.
  • go-ef (‚≠ê39) - A Go implementation of the Elias-Fano encoding.
  • roaring (‚≠ê2.7k) - Go package implementing compressed bitsets.

Bloom and Cuckoo Filters

  • cuckoofilter (‚≠ê1.2k) - Cuckoo filter: a good alternative to a counting bloom filter implemented in Go.
  • ring (‚≠ê141) - Go implementation of a high performance, thread safe bloom filter.

Data Structure and Algorithm Collections

  • algorithms (‚≠ê821) - Algorithms and data structures.CLRS study.
  • go-datastructures (‚≠ê7.8k) - Collection of useful, performant, and thread-safe data structures.
  • gods (‚≠ê17k) - Go Data Structures. Containers, Sets, Lists, Stacks, Maps, BidiMaps, Trees, HashSet etc.
  • gostl (‚≠ê1.1k) - Data structure and algorithm library for go, designed to provide functions similar to C++ STL.

Iterators

  • goterator (‚≠ê17) - Iterator implementation to provide map and reduce functionalities.
  • iter (‚≠ê191) - Go implementation of C++ STL iterators and algorithms.

Maps

  • dict (‚≠ê47) - Python-like dictionaries (dict) for Go.

Nullable Types

  • nan (‚≠ê87) - Zero allocation Nullable structures in one library with handy conversion functions, marshallers and unmarshallers.
  • null (‚≠ê38) - Nullable Go types that can be marshalled/unmarshalled to/from JSON.
  • typ (‚≠ê46) - Null Types, Safe primitive type conversion and fetching value from complex structures.

Queues

  • deque (‚≠ê200) - A highly optimized double-ended queue.
  • deque (‚≠ê690) - Fast ring-buffer deque (double-ended queue).
  • goconcurrentqueue (‚≠ê427) - Concurrent FIFO queue.
  • memlog (‚≠ê133) - An easy to use, lightweight, thread-safe and append-only in-memory data structure inspired by Apache Kafka.

Sets

  • dsu (‚≠ê15) - Disjoint Set data structure implementation in Go.
  • golang-set (‚≠ê4.5k) - Thread-Safe and Non-Thread-Safe high-performance sets for Go.
  • goset (‚≠ê52) - A useful Set collection implementation for Go.
  • set (‚≠ê29) - Simple set data structure implementation in Go using LinkedHashMap.

Text Analysis

  • bleve (‚≠ê10k) - Modern text indexing library for go.
  • go-adaptive-radix-tree (‚≠ê392) - Go implementation of Adaptive Radix Tree.
  • go-edlib (‚≠ê517) - Go string comparison and edit distance algorithms library (Levenshtein, LCS, Hamming, Damerau levenshtein, Jaro-Winkler, etc.) compatible with Unicode.
  • trie (‚≠ê776) - Trie implementation in Go.

Trees

  • hashsplit (‚≠ê31) - Split byte streams into chunks, and arrange chunks into trees, with boundaries determined by content, not position.
  • merkle (‚≠ê19) - Space-efficient computation of Merkle root hashes and inclusion proofs.

Pipes

  • ordered-concurrently (‚≠ê41) - Go module that processes work concurrently and returns output in a channel in the order of input.
  • parapipe (‚≠ê37) - FIFO Pipeline which parallels execution on each stage while maintaining the order of messages and results.
  • pipeline (‚≠ê58) - An implementation of pipelines with fan-in and fan-out.

Caches

  • 2q (‚≠ê47) - 2Q in-memory cache implementation.
  • couchcache (‚≠ê67) - RESTful caching micro-service backed by Couchbase server.
  • fastcache (‚≠ê2.2k) - fast thread-safe inmemory cache for big number of entries. Minimizes GC overhead.
  • GCache (‚≠ê2.7k) - Cache library with support for expirable Cache, LFU, LRU and ARC.
  • gdcache (‚≠ê13) - A pure non-intrusive cache library implemented by golang, you can use it to implement your own distributed cache.
  • go-mcache (‚≠ê98) - Fast in-memory key:value store/cache library. Pointer caches.
  • groupcache (‚≠ê13k) - Groupcache is a caching and cache-filling library, intended as a replacement for memcached in many cases.
  • timedmap (‚≠ê75) - Map with expiring key-value pairs.
  • ttlcache (‚≠ê1.1k) - An in-memory cache with item expiration and generics.
  • ttlcache (‚≠ê10) - In-memory key value storage with TTL for each record.

Databases Implemented in Go

  • badger (‚≠ê15k) - Fast key-value store in Go.
  • bbolt (‚≠ê8.9k) - An embedded key/value database for Go.
  • Bitcask - Bitcask is an embeddable, persistent and fast key-value (KV) database written in pure Go with predictable read/write performance, low latency and high throughput thanks to the bitcask on-disk layout (LSM+WAL).
  • buntdb (‚≠ê4.7k) - Fast, embeddable, in-memory key/value database for Go with custom indexing and spatial support.
  • clover (‚≠ê760) - A lightweight document-oriented NoSQL database written in pure Golang.
  • pudge (‚≠ê373) - Fast and simple key/value store written using Go's standard library.

Database Tools

  • clickhouse-bulk (‚≠ê498) - Collects small inserts and sends big requests to ClickHouse servers.

Interfaces to Multiple Backends

  • cayley (‚≠ê15k) - Graph database with support for multiple backends.
  • dsc (‚≠ê34) - Datastore connectivity for SQL, NoSQL, structured files.
  • gokv (‚≠ê801) - Simple key-value store abstraction and implementations for Go (Redis, Consul, etcd, bbolt, BadgerDB, LevelDB, Memcached, DynamoDB, S3, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, CockroachDB and many more).

Relational Database Drivers

  • avatica (‚≠ê122) - Apache Avatica/Phoenix SQL driver for database/sql.
  • bgc (‚≠ê21) - Datastore Connectivity for BigQuery for go.
  • firebirdsql (‚≠ê243) - Firebird RDBMS SQL driver for Go.
  • go-adodb (‚≠ê148) - Microsoft ActiveX Object DataBase driver for go that uses database/sql.
  • go-mssqldb (‚≠ê1.9k) - Microsoft MSSQL driver for Go.
  • go-oci8 (‚≠ê634) - Oracle driver for go that uses database/sql.
  • go-sql-driver/mysql (‚≠ê15k) - MySQL driver for Go.
  • go-sqlite3 (‚≠ê8.6k) - SQLite3 driver for go that uses database/sql.
  • godror (‚≠ê559) - Oracle driver for Go, using the ODPI-C driver.
  • gofreetds (‚≠ê113) - Microsoft MSSQL driver. Go wrapper over FreeTDS.
  • pgx (‚≠ê12k) - PostgreSQL driver supporting features beyond those exposed by database/sql.
  • pig (‚≠ê17) - Simple pgx (‚≠ê12k) wrapper to execute and scan (‚≠ê1.4k) query results easily.
  • pq (‚≠ê9.5k) - Pure Go Postgres driver for database/sql.
  • Sqinn-Go (‚≠ê450) - SQLite with pure Go.
  • sqlhooks (‚≠ê656) - Attach hooks to any database/sql driver.

NoSQL Database Drivers

  • aerospike-client-go (‚≠ê450) - Aerospike client in Go language.
  • arangolite (‚≠ê72) - Lightweight golang driver for ArangoDB.
  • asc (‚≠ê11) - Datastore Connectivity for Aerospike for go.
  • forestdb (‚≠ê36) - Go bindings for ForestDB.
  • go-couchbase (‚≠ê323) - Couchbase client in Go.
  • go-pilosa (‚≠ê57) - Go client library for Pilosa.
  • go-rejson (‚≠ê343) - Golang client for redislabs' ReJSON module using Redigo golang client. Store and manipulate structs as JSON objects in redis with ease.
  • gocb (‚≠ê373) - Official Couchbase Go SDK.
  • gocosmos (‚≠ê22) - REST client and standard database/sql driver for Azure Cosmos DB.
  • gocql - Go language driver for Apache Cassandra.
  • godis (‚≠ê113) - redis client implement by golang, inspired by jedis.
  • godscache (‚≠ê11) - A wrapper for the Google Cloud Platform Go Datastore package that adds caching using memcached.
  • gomemcache (‚≠ê1.8k) - memcache client library for the Go programming language.
  • gorethink (‚≠ê1.7k) - Go language driver for RethinkDB.
  • goriak (‚≠ê30) - Go language driver for Riak KV.
  • neo4j (‚≠ê29) - Neo4j Rest API Bindings for Golang.
  • neoism (‚≠ê390) - Neo4j client for Golang.
  • qmgo (‚≠ê1.3k) - The MongoDB driver for Go. It‚Äòs based on official MongoDB driver but easier to use like Mgo.
  • redeo (‚≠ê445) - Redis-protocol compatible TCP servers/services.
  • redigo (‚≠ê9.8k) - Redigo is a Go client for the Redis database.
  • rueidis (‚≠ê2.7k) - Fast Redis RESP3 client with auto pipelining and server-assisted client side caching.
  • xredis (‚≠ê19) - Typesafe, customizable, clean & easy to use Redis client.

Search and Analytic Databases

  • elastic (‚≠ê7.5k) - Elasticsearch client for Go.
  • elasticsql (‚≠ê1.2k) - Convert sql to elasticsearch dsl in Go.
  • elastigo (‚≠ê942) - Elasticsearch client library.
  • go-elasticsearch (‚≠ê5.9k) - Official Elasticsearch client for Go.
  • goes (‚≠ê31) - Library to interact with Elasticsearch.
  • skizze (‚≠ê92) - probabilistic data-structures service and storage.

DevOps Tools / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

  • wait-for (‚≠ê17) - Wait for something to happen (from the command line) before continuing. Easy orchestration of Docker services and other things.

items.title: Alternative Internet
items.content_text:
### Cloud and storage

*   [Filebase](https://filebase.com)  is the first S3-compatible object storage platform that allows you to store data in a secure, redundant, and performant manner across multiple decentralized storage networks. Its unique storage backend connects to multiple decentralized storage networks, enabling global presence and reliability. Filebase currently supports storage on the IPFS, Sia, Skynet and Storj networks.
items.content_html:
Cloud and storage

  • Filebase is the first S3-compatible object storage platform that allows you to store data in a secure, redundant, and performant manner across multiple decentralized storage networks. Its unique storage backend connects to multiple decentralized storage networks, enabling global presence and reliability. Filebase currently supports storage on the IPFS, Sia, Skynet and Storj networks.

items.title: Awesome Audit Algorithms
items.content_text:
### Papers / 2021

*   [Auditing Black-Box Prediction Models for Data Minimization Compliance](https://www.cs.bu.edu/faculty/crovella/paper-archive/minimization-audit-Neurips21.pdf) - (NeurIPS) *Measures the level of data minimization satisfied by the prediction model using a limited number of queries.*
items.content_html:
Papers / 2021

  • Auditing Black-Box Prediction Models for Data Minimization Compliance - (NeurIPS) Measures the level of data minimization satisfied by the prediction model using a limited number of queries.

items.title: Awesome Privacy
items.content_text:
### Audio

*   [Spotube (‚≠ê41k)](https://github.com/KRTirtho/spotube) - A lightweight free Spotify crossplatform-client.
*   [Spot\* (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/xou816/spot) - Native Spotify client built in GTK and Rust.
*   [psst\* (‚≠ê9.1k)](https://github.com/jpochyla/psst) - Fast and multi-platform Spotify client with native GUI.
*   [ncspot\* (‚≠ê5.9k)](https://github.com/hrkfdn/ncspot) - Cross-platform ncurses Spotify client written in Rust, inspired by ncmpc and the likes.√ß

### Password Managers

*   [Passky](https://passky.org) - Simple, modern, lightweight, open-source and secure password manager.

### Video and Audio Conferencing / Alternative clients/modifications of Discord:

*   [OpenAsar](https://openasar.dev/) - An open-source alternative of Discord desktop's app.asar that comes with a [No Track (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/GooseMod/OpenAsar/blob/main/src/noTrack.js) function.
items.content_html:
Audio

  • Spotube (‚≠ê41k) - A lightweight free Spotify crossplatform-client.
  • Spot* (‚≠ê2.4k) - Native Spotify client built in GTK and Rust.
  • psst* (‚≠ê9.1k) - Fast and multi-platform Spotify client with native GUI.
  • ncspot* (‚≠ê5.9k) - Cross-platform ncurses Spotify client written in Rust, inspired by ncmpc and the likes.√ß

Password Managers

  • Passky - Simple, modern, lightweight, open-source and secure password manager.

Video and Audio Conferencing / Alternative clients/modifications of Discord:

  • OpenAsar - An open-source alternative of Discord desktop's app.asar that comes with a No Track (‚≠ê2.7k) function.

### Misc

items.title: Awesome Falsehood
items.content_text:
### Multimedia

*   [Horrible edge cases to consider when dealing with music](https://dustri.org/b/horrible-edge-cases-to-consider-when-dealing-with-music.html) - Music catalogs data are full of crazy stuff.
*   [MusicBrainz database schema](https://musicbrainz.org/doc/MusicBrainz_Database/Schema) - An open-source project and database that seems to have solved the complexity of music catalog management.
*   [DDEX](https://ddex.net/standards/) - The industry standard for music metadata, including archiving, sound recording, sales and usage reporting, royalties and license deals.
*   [Apple Music Style Guide](https://help.apple.com/itc/musicstyleguide/en.lproj/static.html) - Quality insurance guidelines to format music, art, and metadata to increase discoverability.
items.content_html:
Multimedia

  • Horrible edge cases to consider when dealing with music - Music catalogs data are full of crazy stuff.
  • MusicBrainz database schema - An open-source project and database that seems to have solved the complexity of music catalog management.
  • DDEX - The industry standard for music metadata, including archiving, sound recording, sales and usage reporting, royalties and license deals.
  • Apple Music Style Guide - Quality insurance guidelines to format music, art, and metadata to increase discoverability.

items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### System 1 & System 2 / Dual-Coding Theory

*   [A continuous semantic space describes the representation of thousands of object and action categories across the human brain](https://mri-q.com/uploads/3/4/5/7/34572113/gallant_piis0896627312009348.pdf) - ***Neuron***, 2012. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=10348115268396987731\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].

### Methodologies for Experiments / Scaling Up Behavioral Studies

*   [Machine-generated theories of human decision-making](https://cpb-us-w2.wpmucdn.com/web.sas.upenn.edu/dist/a/511/files/2021/06/Bhatia-He-Science.pdf) - ***Science***, 2021. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=7065547001880027350\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [Integrating explanation and prediction in computational social science](http://jakehofman.com/pdfs/integrating-prediction-and-explanation.pdf) - ***Nature***, 2021. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=288245575125750925\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].

### Methodologies for Experiments / Question Answering

*   [Do People Ask Good Questions?](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s42113-018-0005-5) - ***Computational Brain & Behavior***, 2018. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=14595996621617337270\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [Asking goal-oriented questions and learning from answers](http://nyuccl.org/papers/Rothe-Lake-Gureckis-2019-Cogsci.pdf) - ***CogSci'19***, 2019. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=14185546187726917682\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
items.content_html:
System 1 & System 2 / Dual-Coding Theory

  • A continuous semantic space describes the representation of thousands of object and action categories across the human brain - Neuron, 2012. [All Versions].

Methodologies for Experiments / Scaling Up Behavioral Studies

  • Machine-generated theories of human decision-making - Science, 2021. [All Versions].
  • Integrating explanation and prediction in computational social science - Nature, 2021. [All Versions].

Methodologies for Experiments / Question Answering

  • Do People Ask Good Questions? - Computational Brain & Behavior, 2018. [All Versions].
  • Asking goal-oriented questions and learning from answers - CogSci'19, 2019. [All Versions].

items.title: Awesome Db Tools
items.content_text:
### Schema / Changes

*   [Atlas (‚≠ê7k)](https://github.com/ariga/atlas) - Inspect and Apply changes to your database schema.
*   [pg-osc (‚≠ê586)](https://github.com/shayonj/pg-osc) - Easy CLI tool for making zero downtime schema changes and backfills in PostgreSQL.
*   [Reshape (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/fabianlindfors/reshape) - An easy-to-use, zero-downtime schema migration tool for Postgres.
*   [sqldef (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/k0kubun/sqldef) - Idempotent schema management for MySQL, PostgreSQL, and more.

### Schema / Diagrams

*   [ERAlchemy (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/Alexis-benoist/eralchemy) - Entity Relation Diagrams generation tool.

### Schema / Documentations

*   [dbdocs](https://dbdocs.io/) - Create web-based database documentation using DSL code.
*   [DBML (‚≠ê3.3k)](https://github.com/holistics/dbml) - Database Markup Language, designed to define and document database structures.
*   [SchemaCrawler (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/schemacrawler/SchemaCrawler) - A free database schema discovery and comprehension tool.
*   [Schema Spy (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/schemaspy/schemaspy) - Generating your database to HTML documentation, including Entity Relationship diagrams.
*   [tbls (‚≠ê3.9k)](https://github.com/k1LoW/tbls) - CI-Friendly tool for document a database, written in Go.

### Schema / Design

*   [Database Design (‚≠ê488)](https://github.com/alextanhongpin/database-design) - Useful tips for designing robust database schema.
*   [DBDiagram](https://dbdiagram.io) - A free, simple tool to draw ER diagrams by just writing code.
*   [ERBuilder Data Modeler](https://soft-builder.com/erbuilder-data-modeler) - Easy-to-use database modeling software for high-quality data models. It's a complete data modeling solution for data modelers and data architects.
*   [Navicat Data Modeler](https://www.navicat.com/en/products/navicat-data-modeler) - A powerful and cost-effective database design tool which helps you build high-quality conceptual, logical and physical data models.
*   [Oracle SQL Developer Data Modeler](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/developer-tools/datamodeler/overview/index.html) - Oracle SQL Developer Data Modeler is a free graphical tool that enhances productivity and simplifies data modeling tasks.
*   [pgmodeler (‚≠ê3.3k)](https://github.com/pgmodeler/pgmodeler) - Data modeling tool designed for PostgreSQL.

### Schema / Samples

*   [Oracle Database Sample Schemas (‚≠ê824)](https://github.com/oracle/db-sample-schemas) - Oracle Database Sample Schemas.

### Monitoring/Statistics/Perfomance / Samples

*   [pgbadger (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/dalibo/pgbadger) - A fast PostgreSQL Log Analyzer.
*   [pgMonitor (‚≠ê658)](https://github.com/CrunchyData/pgmonitor) - All-in-one tool to easily create an environment to visualize the health and performance of your PostgreSQL cluster.
*   [PostgreSQL Metrics (‚≠ê596)](https://github.com/spotify/postgresql-metrics) - Service to extract and provide metrics on your PostgreSQL database.
*   [postgres-checkup](https://gitlab.com/postgres-ai/postgres-checkup) - New-generation diagnostics tool that allows users to do a deep analysis of the health of Postgres databases.
*   [Promscale (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/timescale/promscale) - The open-source observability backend for metrics and traces powered by SQL.

### Testing / Zabbix

*   [SQLancer (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/sqlancer/sqlancer) - Automatically test DBMS in order to find logic bugs in their implementation.

### HA/Failover/Sharding / Zabbix

*   [pgslice (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/ankane/pgslice) - Postgres partitioning as easy as pie.

### SQL / Parsers

*   [libpg\_query (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/pganalyze/libpg_query) - C library for accessing the PostgreSQL parser outside of the server environment.

### SQL / √úber SQL

*   [osquery (‚≠ê23k)](https://github.com/osquery/osquery) - SQL powered operating system instrumentation, monitoring, and analytics.

### SQL / Plan

*   [pev2 (‚≠ê3k)](https://github.com/dalibo/pev2) - A VueJS component to show a graphical vizualization of a PostgreSQL execution plan.
*   [pg\_flame (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/mgartner/pg_flame) - A flamegraph generator for Postgres `EXPLAIN ANALYZE` output.

### Data / Catalog

*   [Amundsen (‚≠ê4.6k)](https://github.com/amundsen-io/amundsen) - Metadata driven application for improving the productivity of data analysts, data scientists and engineers when interacting with data.
*   [DataHub (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/datahub-project/datahub) - The Metadata Platform for the Modern Data Stack.
*   [Marquez (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/MarquezProject/marquez) - Collect, aggregate, and visualize a data ecosystem's metadata.

### Data / Generation/Masking/Subsetting

*   [Benerator (‚≠ê150)](https://github.com/rapiddweller/rapiddweller-benerator-ce) - Generate, obfuscate (anonymize / pseudonymize) and migrate data for development, testing and training purposes.
*   [dbForge Data Generator for MySQL](https://www.devart.com/dbforge/mysql/data-generator) - Powerful GUI tool for creating massive volumes of realistic test data.
*   [dbForge Data Generator for Oracle](https://www.devart.com/dbforge/oracle/data-generator) - Small but mighty GUI tool for populating Oracle schemas with tons of realistic test data.
*   [dbForge Data Generator for SQL Server](https://www.devart.com/dbforge/sql/data-generator) - Powerful GUI tool for a fast generation of meaningful test data for databases.
*   [Faker (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/faker-js/faker) - Generate massive amounts of fake data in the browser and Node.js.
*   [Noisia (‚≠ê697)](https://github.com/lesovsky/noisia) - Harmful workload generator for PostgreSQL.
*   [SB Data Generator](https://soft-builder.com/sb-data-generator) - Simple and powerful tool to generate and populate selected tables or entire databases with realistic test data for your applications. Generate test data for: Oracle, MS SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Firebird, SQLite, Azure SQL Database, Amazon Redshift and Amazon RDS.
items.content_html:
Schema / Changes

  • Atlas (‚≠ê7k) - Inspect and Apply changes to your database schema.
  • pg-osc (‚≠ê586) - Easy CLI tool for making zero downtime schema changes and backfills in PostgreSQL.
  • Reshape (‚≠ê1.8k) - An easy-to-use, zero-downtime schema migration tool for Postgres.
  • sqldef (‚≠ê2.2k) - Idempotent schema management for MySQL, PostgreSQL, and more.

Schema / Diagrams

  • ERAlchemy (‚≠ê1.2k) - Entity Relation Diagrams generation tool.

Schema / Documentations

  • dbdocs - Create web-based database documentation using DSL code.
  • DBML (‚≠ê3.3k) - Database Markup Language, designed to define and document database structures.
  • SchemaCrawler (‚≠ê1.7k) - A free database schema discovery and comprehension tool.
  • Schema Spy (‚≠ê3.4k) - Generating your database to HTML documentation, including Entity Relationship diagrams.
  • tbls (‚≠ê3.9k) - CI-Friendly tool for document a database, written in Go.

Schema / Design

  • Database Design (‚≠ê488) - Useful tips for designing robust database schema.
  • DBDiagram - A free, simple tool to draw ER diagrams by just writing code.
  • ERBuilder Data Modeler - Easy-to-use database modeling software for high-quality data models. It's a complete data modeling solution for data modelers and data architects.
  • Navicat Data Modeler - A powerful and cost-effective database design tool which helps you build high-quality conceptual, logical and physical data models.
  • Oracle SQL Developer Data Modeler - Oracle SQL Developer Data Modeler is a free graphical tool that enhances productivity and simplifies data modeling tasks.
  • pgmodeler (‚≠ê3.3k) - Data modeling tool designed for PostgreSQL.

Schema / Samples

  • Oracle Database Sample Schemas (‚≠ê824) - Oracle Database Sample Schemas.

Monitoring/Statistics/Perfomance / Samples

  • pgbadger (‚≠ê25) - A fast PostgreSQL Log Analyzer.

  • PostgreSQL Metrics (‚≠ê596) - Service to extract and provide metrics on your PostgreSQL database.
  • postgres-checkup - New-generation diagnostics tool that allows users to do a deep analysis of the health of Postgres databases.
  • Promscale (‚≠ê1.3k) - The open-source observability backend for metrics and traces powered by SQL.
